definition: a winding path or course, labyrinth
examples: the new path, which he supposed only to make a few meanders

definition: a turn or winding of a stream
examples: The meander eventually became isolated from the main stream.

definition: to follow a winding or intricate course
examples: across the ceiling meandered a long crack

definition: to wander aimlessly or casually without urgent destination : ramble
examples: he meandered with the sightseers gawping at the boat people
